trans-unit.source: BizTalk Flat File Encode Decode connector helps your app interop between flat file data (example excel, csv) and XML data.
trans-unit.target: BizTalk Flat File Encode Decode connector helps your app interop between flat file data (example excel, csv) and XML data.

trans-unit.source: It can convert a given flat file instance to XML and vice versa.
trans-unit.target: It can convert a given flat file instance to XML and vice versa.

trans-unit.source: Using the BizTalk Flat File Encoder
trans-unit.target: Using the BizTalk Flat File Encoder

trans-unit.source: To use the BizTalk Flat File Encoder, you need to first create an instance of the BizTalk Flat File Encoder API app.
trans-unit.target: To use the BizTalk Flat File Encoder, you need to first create an instance of the BizTalk Flat File Encoder API app.

trans-unit.source: This can be done either inline while creating a logic app or by selecting the BizTalk Flat File Encoder API app from the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: This can be done either inline while creating a logic app or by selecting the BizTalk Flat File Encoder API app from the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: BizTalk Flat File Encoder takes schemas as part of its configuration.
trans-unit.target: BizTalk Flat File Encoder takes schemas as part of its configuration.

trans-unit.source: Users can launch the API App configuration blade by either launching the API App directly from the Azure portal, or by double-clicking the API App on the designer surface.
trans-unit.target: Users can launch the API App configuration blade by either launching the API App directly from the Azure portal, or by double-clicking the API App on the designer surface.

trans-unit.source: In the API App blade, users can configure schemas by clicking on *Schemas* part.
trans-unit.target: In the API App blade, users can configure schemas by clicking on *Schemas* part.

trans-unit.source: Users can upload schemas from disk or generate one from a flat file instance or a JSON instance.
trans-unit.target: Users can upload schemas from disk or generate one from a flat file instance or a JSON instance.

trans-unit.source: Using the BizTalk Flat File Encoder in design surface
trans-unit.target: Using the BizTalk Flat File Encoder in design surface

trans-unit.source: Once configured, users can click on *->* and choose an action from a list of actions.
trans-unit.target: Once configured, users can click on *->* and choose an action from a list of actions.

trans-unit.source: ![BizTalk Flat File Encoder List of actions][4]
trans-unit.target: ![BizTalk Flat File Encoder List of actions][4]

trans-unit.source: ![BizTalk Flat File Encoder List of actions][5]
trans-unit.target: ![BizTalk Flat File Encoder List of actions][5]

trans-unit.source: Content of the input flat file
trans-unit.target: Content of the input flat file

trans-unit.source: Name of the schema which represents the input flat file
trans-unit.target: Name of the schema which represents the input flat file

trans-unit.source: Root node name of the flat file schema
trans-unit.target: Root node name of the flat file schema

trans-unit.source: The action returns the output as a string - Output Xml.
trans-unit.target: The action returns the output as a string - Output Xml.

trans-unit.source: Output Xml contains the xml representation of the input flat file content.
trans-unit.target: Output Xml contains the xml representation of the input flat file content.

trans-unit.source: ![BizTalk Flat File Encoder List of actions][6]
trans-unit.target: ![BizTalk Flat File Encoder List of actions][6]

trans-unit.source: The action returns the output as a string - Flat File.
trans-unit.target: The action returns the output as a string - Flat File.

trans-unit.source: Output contains the flat file representation of the input xml content.
trans-unit.target: Output contains the flat file representation of the input xml content.
